description: Former US Representative George Santos should be sentenced to more than seven years in prison for committing fraud while campaigning for Congress, federal prosecutors said.
title: George Santos Should Get Seven Years for Campaign Fraud, US Says

description: Canada’s government supports doubling the scale of an already-huge natural gas project on the west coast and now sees it as “likely,” according to its resources minister, as the country pushes to diversify exports away from a hostile US.
title: Canada Minister Wants LNG Canada Doubled, Eyes Western Pipeline Upgrade

description: The US Energy Department has identified 8,500 jobs as “non-essential” — including positions that oversee the nation’s stockpile of nuclear weapons — as it prepares to cut employees in response to a mandate from Elon Musk’s government efficiency team.
title: Nuclear Bomb Staffers on Energy Agency’s 8,500-Job ‘Non-Essential’ List

description: The Trump administration’s purge of national security officials this week has thrown a spotlight on the president’s ties to far-right activist Laura Loomer and raised questions about the direction of White House strategy as it seeks to end Russia’s war on Ukraine, challenge Iran’s nuclear program and counter China’s rising military might.
title: Trump’s National Security Purge Spotlights Far-Right Activist Laura Loomer

description: The plunge in oil prices over the past two days following the twin shocks of President Donald Trump’s tariffs and the surprise boost in production from OPEC+ has altered the global energy landscape with stunning speed.
title: Oil in Freefall Reorders Energy Landscape From US to Middle East

description: Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins said she is headed to Vietnam, after President Donald Trump said the Southeast Asian nation is looking to cut a deal to avoid sharp tariffs on their exports to the US.
title: US Agriculture Head to Visit Vietnam as Trump Teases Tariff Deal

description: A federal judge gave the government until the end of Monday to return a man to the US after it said it had mistakenly sent him to a prison in El Salvador in an “administrative error.”
title: US Ordered to Return Man Mistakenly Sent to El Salvador Prison

description: President Donald Trump had nearly clinched an agreement with TikTok’s Chinese owner ByteDance Ltd. that would spare the popular app from a US ban, but the deal was scuttled after China withheld its approval following this week’s tariff announcement, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Trump’s TikTok Plan Upended by Chinese Objections Over Tariffs

description: US colleges facing the threat of federal funding cuts under President Donald Trump’s administration are tapping short-term borrowing to preserve cash.
title: Cornell, Brown Look to Alternative Funding After Trump Threats

description: The US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Agency will preserve access to websites tied to its research division, after previously moving to cancel a cloud web services contract that supports many of its pages.
title: US Weather Agency to Preserve Research Websites in Reversal

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: TikTok Becomes Bargaining Chip in Trade War

description: The International Criminal Court sparked an angry response from Israel in November when it issued arrest warrants for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and the nation’s former defense minister for alleged war crimes in the Gaza Strip. The government denied the charges, saying its conduct in the conflict is in line with international law, and Netanyahu’s office said the ICC’s decision was “motivated by anti-Semitic hatred of Israel.”
title: All About the ICC Case Against Israel’s Netanyahu

description: Senator Ted Cruz, usually a staunch supporter of President Donald Trump, sounded the alarm on the administration’s move to ramp up tariffs, saying they pose “enormous risks” to the US economy and make Republicans vulnerable to a “bloodbath” in next year’s midterm elections.
title: Ted Cruz Warns Tariffs Risk Sparking GOP Wipeout in 2026 Elections

description: House Financial Services Chairman French Hill said across the-board-tariffs don’t always come with a measurable goal, signaling reservations about the Trump administration’s far-reaching levies that were unveiled this week.
title: Republican House Finance Chair Says Across-the-Board Tariffs Hard to Measure

description: Chief White House economist Stephen Miran dismissed the deepening fears of a recession on Wall Street, saying that President Donald Trump’s plans for deregulation and tax cuts will more than offset any hit from tariff hikes.
title: White House’s Miran Rejects Recession Fear, Touts Deregulation

description: President Donald Trump said he has decided to extend the deadline for Chinese firm ByteDance Ltd. to divest TikTok’s US operations and give his administration more time to finalize a plan to keep the popular app running in the the country.
title: Trump Extends TikTok Deadline 75 Days to Save App in US

description: The International Monetary Fund’s executive board met this week to discuss a new Argentina program during an informal session in Washington, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: IMF Met Again on Argentina as Upfront Payment Proves Contentious

description: Berkshire Hathaway Inc. said Friday that all reports circulating on social media sites including X, TikTok and Facebook “regarding comments allegedly made” by Warren Buffett are false.
title: Buffett Says Comments Attributed to Him on X Are All False

description: The Trump administration’s efforts to slash the federal workforce is beginning to show up in employment data, with the brunt of those cuts still to come.
title: DOGE Firings Crop Up in Jobs Data But Total Scope Still Lags

description: The Bank of Italy cut its forecast for growth this year, reckoning that new US tariffs will hold back expansion in the euro zone’s third-biggest economy.
title: Bank of Italy Cuts 2025 Outlook in Wake of Trump’s Tariffs

description: A barrage of tariffs unleashed by US President Donald Trump has sparked a discussion among NATO members on whether the move breaches the military alliance’s treaty.
title: Trump’s Tariffs Spark Debate on Possible Breach of NATO Treaty

description: A majority of European Union member governments favor inviting the UK and Canada to join the EU’s proposed €150 billion ($165 billion) defense spending fund, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Most EU Members Seek UK, Canada Access to €150 Billion Arms Fund

description: Jonathan Braun was arrested by US Marshals last Saturday, according to people familiar with the matter
title: Loan Shark Freed by Trump Said to Be Arrested by Federal Agents

description: The Trump administration was sued by a group of Democrat-led states that claim the federal government is illegally canceling research grants that fund what they describe as critical medical and scientific advancements.
title: States Sue Trump Administration Over Canceled Research Grants

description: President Donald Trump called on Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell to slash interest rates, reiterating his longstanding desire for the central bank to keep rates low to stoke consumer demand.
title: Trump Pressures Powell to Slash Interest Rates Ahead of Speech

description: China is imposing new export controls on several rare earth elements and related products that are crucial components for defense and technology, and have become a focal point for US President Donald Trump.
title: China’s Rare Earths Curbs Put Multiple US Industries at Risk

description: California Governor Gavin Newsom said he will pursue new international trade partnerships to counter Donald Trump’s proposed tariffs, casting the state as a bulwark against what he called the “largest tax hike of our lifetime.”
title: Newsom Says California Ready to Talk With Trading Partners

description: South African business leaders have written to the leaders of the country’s two biggest parties imploring them to settle their differences and keep the ruling coalition intact.
title: South Africa Businesses Ask Ramaphosa to Save Ruling Coalition

description: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu is leaning into her newfound role as both a favorite foil for Republican critics in Washington and a capable messenger for Democrats as her reelection campaign heats up.
title: Boston Mayor Wu Embraces Trump Resistance as Campaign Heats Up

description: The European Union is realistic about what near-term deliverables the bloc’s chief trade negotiator, Maros Sefcovic, can attain when he begins talks with his US counterparts on Friday about President Donald Trump’s far-reaching tariffs.
title: EU to Discuss Lowering Tariffs in First Talks With Trump’s Team

description: President Donald Trump said his economic policies “will never change,” as his sweeping tariffs continued to wreak havoc on the global economy.
title: Trump Says ‘Policies Will Never Change’ Amid Tariff Fallout

description: The Justice Department is weighing whether to release companies from obligations to hire outside monitors as part of settlements with prosecutors — a form of oversight that has long frustrated executives.
title: DOJ Weighs Getting Rid of a Punishment That Companies Despise

description: President Donald Trump’s tariffs on most of the US’s trading partners will undermine a 25-year-old pact that gave many of the poorest African nations duty-free access to the world’s biggest economy.
title: Trump Tariffs to Supersede US Congress-Backed Africa Trade Pact

description: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Wednesday, April 2, 2025. President Donald Trump's deliberations over his plans to impose reciprocal tariffs are coming down to the wire, with his team said to be still finalizing the level and scope of new import taxes he is slated to unveil on Wednesday afternoon. Photographer Michael Nagle/Bloomberg
title: Powell Set to Speak as Trump Urges Him to Cut Rates Now

description: Nouriel Roubini predicted that the stock market correction may deepen before investor sentiment then stabilizes as US President Donald Trump dials down his global trade onslaught.
title: Roubini Sees More Market Drops Before Trump Turns ‘Rational’

description: Business groups are mobilizing to squelch a plan gathering momentum among Republicans to curtail a heavily used federal income tax break that allows corporations to deduct state and local taxes.
title: Businesses Pounce as GOP Weighs Limiting Corporate SALT Break

description: President Donald Trump threw his support behind France’s embattled far-right leader only hours after French President Emmanuel Macron urged European companies to pause investments in the US over Washington’s trade war.
title: Trump Calls France’s Trial of Far-Right Leader a ‘Witch Hunt’

description: South Africa’s government said it would be ill considered and counterproductive to rush into imposing reciprocal tariffs on imports from the US after Washington hit it with punitive charges.
title: South Africa Wary of Imposing Reciprocal Trade Tariffs on US

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Romania’s Redo Election Is a Global Matter Now

description: More than three in four Canadians would support publicly funding an oil pipeline to carry crude from Alberta to eastern Canada, according to a poll commissioned by Bloomberg.
title: Most Canadians Support Building an Oil Pipeline to Sidestep US Market

description: After a South Korea court ruled unanimously to oust President Yoon Suk Yeol from office, some protesters that had been gathered in central Seoul jumped for joy, while others wept and rued the end of democracy.
title: Yoon’s Dramatic Ouster Divides South Korea at Perilous Moment

description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said he hasn’t made a decision yet on extending anti-graft commission chief Azam Baki’s contract, according to state news agency Bernama.
title: Malaysia PM Says No Decision Yet on Anti-Graft Chief: Bernama

description: France ruled out further spending cuts to meet its deficit reduction target if a trade war hammers the economy, casting doubt over efforts to repair the country’s creaking public finances.
title: France Will Let Deficit Goal Slip If Trade War Hurts Economy

description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has indicated he would look to buy back the Port of Darwin from Chinese company Landbridge under a reelected Labor government, the most significant move yet to bring the strategic asset once more under Australian ownership.
title: Australia Seeks Port of Darwin Buy-Back From Chinese Firm, PM Says

description: Thai police have issued an arrest warrant for an American academic based in the Southeast Asian nation for allegedly insulting the monarchy.
title: Thailand Moves to Arrest US Academic for Alleged Royal Insult

description: Ukraine’s European allies and Canada urged Russian President Vladimir Putin to respond immediately to a US proposal for a partial ceasefire that Kyiv has accepted without conditions.
title: Europe, Canada Call on Putin to Respond to US Ceasefire Proposal

description: Understanding Trump’s big tariffs.
title: Lots More on a Massive, Historical, Stagflationary Shock

description: On Wednesday, President Trump unveiled sweeping tariffs against almost every country in the world. The size and scope was far beyond what anyone was anticipating, causing markets to subsequently plunge. But what’s next? Could it work out for the US? Will we see a spike in inflation? Will the global trading system continue to operate? On this episode, we speak with Tom Orlik, the chief economist for Bloomberg Economics, on the historical nature of this stagflationary shock, and what happens to th
title: Lots More on a Massive, Historic, Stagflationary Shock (Podcast)

description: A regional grouping of countries accounting for almost a quarter of the world’s population agreed to work closely to better integrate their economies by boosting trade and transport linkages.
title: Seven-Member Regional Bloc Agrees to Boost Trade, Connectivity

description: French Finance Minister Eric Lombard said the European Union is discussing a broad palette of responses to US tariffs that could include measures hitting large American tech firms.
title: France Says EU Discussing Digital to Respond to US Tariffs

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban pledged to tighten rules on protests in response to a fresh series of demonstrations in Budapest.
title: Hungary’s Orban Vows to Tighten Laws on Assembly After Protests

description: Canada is aiming to put maximum pressure on US President Donald Trump in response to his barrage of tariffs, Foreign Minister Melanie Joly said, adding that it intends to pivot to Europe and Asia to find new markets.
title: Canada’s Joly Aims for Maximum Pressure on Trump, Europe Pivot

description: Israel has sent soldiers into parts of northern Gaza, saying it wants to expand a buffer zone there as it escalates operations against Hamas.
title: Israeli Army Moves Into North Gaza to Increase Pressure on Hamas

description: The race for South Korea’s next president has kicked off after the Constitutional Court upheld Yoon Suk Yeol’s impeachment, permanently removing him from office. A handful of candidates will jostle for the country’s highest position ahead of an election, which must be held by June 3.
title: Opposition Chief Leads Candidates Eyeing South Korean Presidency

description: A former Finance Ministry bureaucrat says he has been targeted under the rule of Hakainde Hichilema for sounding the alarm on alleged misuse of government funds. The administration has stayed silent.
title: Zambia’s President Pledged to Fight Graft. A Whistleblower is Claiming to Call His Bluff.

description: The Philippines is seeking to increase its exports to the US after President Donald Trump imposed tariffs on Manila that are lower compared with its regional peers.
title: Philippines Eyes More Chips, Food Exports to US as Tariff Milder

description: The Indian Parliament passed amendments to a controversial decades-old law governing Muslim-owned properties donated for religious and charitable purposes, after lengthy debates in both houses.
title: India Parliament Passes Controversial Muslim Property Law

description: Bangkok city administration began clearing debris from a tower that crashed in last week’s earthquake, as hopes of finding survivors among the dozens of workers feared still trapped was all but over.
title: Bangkok Clears Debris of Collapsed Tower as Dozens Still Missing

description: Bucharest Mayor Nicusor Dan was out of town receiving a civic award when he noticed that everyone in the audience had stopped listening to him. They were all frantically scrolling on their phones instead.
title: Bucharest Mayor Bids for Presidency With TikTok-Led Campaign

description: Indonesia pledged to ease trade rules as it seeks to negotiate with the US on the latter’s plan to impose a 32% tariff on products from Southeast Asia’s largest economy.
title: Indonesia Seeks US Negotiations, Pledges to Ease Trade Barriers

description: The Trump administration is ratcheting up pressure on Harvard University with a list of demands including the elimination of diversity, equity and inclusion programs, days after threatening to end as much as $9 billion in federal funding for the school.
title: Harvard Ordered to End DEI as Part of Trump Funding Ultimatum

description: General Timothy Haugh was removed from his position leading the National Security Agency, according to two top Democrats on the Senate and House Intelligence Committees, who assailed the departure.
title: National Security Agency Leader Haugh Ousted, Democrats Say

description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese will travel to the US to meet with President Donald Trump “as soon as possible” in the event he wins a May 3 election, saying his officials have already been in contact with their American counterparts following Washington’s tariff announcement.
title: Australian PM Will Visit Trump ‘as Soon as Possible’ After Vote

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s political gamble to declare martial law in December, which resulted in his impeachment by the National Assembly, has ended with his dramatic ouster from power less than three years after he took office.
title: What Next for South Korea After President Yoon Ousted

description: Vice President JD Vance sought to cast a global rout in stocks as a temporary pain as the White House downplayed the immediate effects of President Donald Trump’s tariff agenda.
title: Vance Downplays ‘One Bad Day’ for Markets, Promising Boom Later

description: Chinese and US defense officials had their first known formal contact since Donald Trump returned to the White House, in a meeting that partially coincided with Beijing conducting large-scale military drills around Taiwan.
title: China, US Make First-Known Military Contact Since Trump’s Inauguration

description: Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda and his deputy sought to convey relative calm and policy continuity after Donald Trump’s latest tariff announcement upended financial markets.
title: BOJ’s Ueda Aims to Convey Continuity After Tariffs Upend Markets

description: Discussions over the future of the North American free trade pact could be pushed earlier than originally planned, said one of Mexico’s top trade negotiators.
title: Mexico Trade Negotiator Says USMCA Discussions May Be Sped Up

description: Malaysian manufacturers are urging the government to refrain from introducing additional tax burdens this year after the US announced a 24% reciprocal tariff on the Southeast Asian country, citing cost pressures.
title: Malaysian Firms Make Case Against New Taxes Post-Trump Tariffs

description: The US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Agency is poised to eliminate most websites tied to its research division under plans for the cancellation of a cloud web services contract, a move that could snarl operations at several labs.
title: US Weather Agency Websites to Vanish Under Planned Contract Cuts

description: Samsung Electronics Co.’s profit was probably held back by a loss in the foundry business as the company works to catch up in artificial intelligence memory chip development, while US export restrictions contributed to lower semiconductor shipments to China.
title: Samsung Stung by US Chip Restrictions, Seven & i Seeks Footing

description: Vietnam’s trade ministry has asked the Trump administration to put on hold its planned 46% tariff on imported Vietnamese products and engage in further negotiations.
title: Vietnam Asks US to Postpone Tariff and Engage in Negotiations

description: SEOUL, SOUTH KOREA - APRIL 04: Supporters of impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol gather on April 04, 2025 in Seoul, South Korea. South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol has been released from detention following a court's decision to annul his arrest warrant related to charges of insurrection stemming from his brief declaration of martial law in December. As he awaits a ruling from the Constitutional Court on his impeachment, which could either restore him to power or lead to his removal, the political landscape in South Korea remains deeply divided, reflecting ongoing tensions between conservative and liberal factions. (Photo by Han Myung-Gu/Getty Images)
title: South Korea Awaits Court Verdict on President Yoon’s Impeachment

description: US special envoy Steve Witkoff and a Russian negotiator met on Wednesday and Thursday in Washington, days after US President Donald Trump expressed frustration with Vladimir Putin over the lack of momentum on negotiations toward a ceasefire in the Ukraine war.
title: Witkoff, Putin Envoy Meet in Washington as Trump Grows Impatient

description: Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba will meet Friday with opposition leaders to discuss responses to US tariffs following a report that the Japanese government is considering compiling an extra budget to fund relief measures for businesses and households.
title: Japan’s PM, Opposition Parties to Discuss US Tariff Responses

description: Asia is bearing the brunt of new US tariffs which will drag on regional growth through weaker business investment and sentiment, requiring central banks to step in with more interest-rate cuts, economists reckon.
title: Asia Bears Brunt of Trump Tariffs, Needs to Ease, Economists Say

description: President Donald Trump was sued in Florida by a small retail stationery business which claims it will suffer “severe” harm from his “unconstitutional” tariffs on China.
title: Trump Sued Over Tariffs by Small US Firm Claiming ‘Severe’ Harm
